name: Avoid data corruption during incompatible mutation (ABAP)
description:
This rule identifies ABAP control elements that contain data which are updated with a value which has an incompatible type. 
This quality rule checks if exceptions are correctly used. 

Note: This quality rule implements the rule ASCSM-CWE-681 of the CISQ standard.
output:
Associated to each ABAP artifact in violation, the Quality Rule provides: 
- The number of risky type cast operations 
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in source code: 
  - Type cast operation
rationale: Software featuring weak conversion practices incurs the risk of using the wrong value and generating incorrect results, possibly introducing new vulnerability when related to resource allocation and security decision.
reference: ASCSM 1.0, Automated Source Code Security Measure, Object Management Group.
remediationSample:
DATA myChar1(9) TYPE c.
DATA myChar2(9) TYPE c.
myChar1 = myChar2.
------------------------------------------------
DATA myDate TYPE d.
DATA myChar(8) TYPE c.
myDate = myChar.
-------------------------------------------------
DATA myDate TYPE d.
DATA myChar(8) TYPE c.
MOVE myChar to myDate.
-------------------------------------------------
DATA myTime TYPE t.
DATA myChar(6) TYPE c.
myChar= myTime.
-------------------------------------------------
DATA myFloat TYPE f.
DATA myChar(6) TYPE c.
myChar= myFloat.
